intro: Aristea intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate arnoldia, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
